content: new yarn on top for help chat and maybe a kal why not join us in the stitchnerds group on ravelry © susan ashcroft 2013 - for personal non-commercial use only clever cowl cullercoats 3 sizing table the table is a guide to the number of stitches you will need to cast on for a given size but will only be accurate if your gauge is close to the gauge in column 2 - you may need to change needle size you can also adjust the stitch numbers to get a different size - use a multiple of 4 +3 you can adjust the height of the cowl to suit your taste or the amount of yarn you have available note about needle size use a needle that is shorter than the circumference of the cowl you want to make if not you ll have to use the magic loop technique to pick up the slack in the cable yarn weight gauge needle single loop daughter size double loop xl double per size approx approx approx loop 10cm/4 66cm/26 85cm/33 132cm/52 approx 180cm/6 fingering/sock 18 sts 3 5-4mm 119 151 239 323 us4-6 dk 16 sts 4 5mm us7 107 139 215 287 worsted/aran 14 sts 5mm us 8 95 119 191 251 swatching the stitch is designed to be knitted using 2 colours and the special technique so that all row are the same if you want to make a swatch it ll be a bit trickier you ll have to use double-pointed needles and slide the stitches back to work 2 row on each side note that it will be easier to knit the cowl than the swatch ☺ using mc cast on a multiple of 4 + 3 rs - mc *k3 sl1pw wyif repeat from * to last 3 sts k3 rs again - cc p1 * sl1pw wyib p3 repeat from * to last 2 sts sl1pw wyib p1 ws - mc *p3 sl1pw wyib repeat from * to last 3 sts p3 ws again - cc k1 *sl1pw wyif k3 repeat from * to last 2 sts slpw wyif k1 © susan ashcroft 2013 - for personal non-commercial use only
